entry.programlisting: <element xmlns="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0" xmlns:a="http://relaxng.org/ns/compatibility/annotations/1.0" name="div"> <optional> <ref name="e.cont"/> </optional> <ref name="e.id"/> <optional> <ref name="e.margin"/> </optional> <optional> <ref name="e.head"/> </optional> <oneOrMore> <choice> <text/> <ref name="e.ab"/> <ref name="m.phrase"/> </choice> </oneOrMore> <optional> <ref name="e.cont"/> </optional> </element>

<element xmlns="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0" xmlns:a="http://relaxng.org/ns/compatibility/annotations/1.0" name="figure"> <optional> <ref name="e.id"/> </optional> <optional> <ref name="e.margin"/> </optional> <optional> <element name="link"> <data type="anyURI"/> </element> </optional>
<oneOrMore> <choice> <ref name="m.phrase"/> <element name="caption"> <oneOrMore> <choice> <text/> <ref name="m.phrase"/> </choice> </oneOrMore> </element> </choice> </oneOrMore> </element>

entry.para: Root element for transcription of folio

entry.programlisting: <element xmlns="http://relaxng.org/ns/structure/1.0" xmlns:a="http://relaxng.org/ns/compatibility/annotations/1.0" name="root"> <a:documentation>Root element for transcription of folio</a:documentation> <mixed> <element name="page"> <data type="NMTOKEN"/> </element> <element name="image"> <data type="anyURI"/> </element> <oneOrMore> <choice> <!-- <text/> --> <ref name="e.ab"/> <ref name="e.figure"/> <ref name="e.div"/> </choice> </oneOrMore> </mixed> </element>

entry.para: Anonymous Block: a generic block of text for. (TEI Element)
Addition: Text added to the document by author, scribe, but *not* by a transcriber
Currency Term: Coins and currency (only type of coin, not amount) [if it is a price without being a coin, let an instructor know]
Continued: An empty element indicating that the parent block is continued on another page or continues from another page
Correction: A revision introduced into the transcription by the transcriber/Editor
Deletion: Content deleted in the document by author, scribe, but *not* by a transcriber
Text Division: A group of one or more document objects forming a primary textual component; e.g., an "entry" or "recipe". TEI Element
Environment: Reference to a physical space or environment, such as workshop space, mountains, forest, etc.
Figure: a graphical object in the source document
Heading: a block of text at the beginning of a textual division functioning ad the heading or title of that division. TEI Element
Identifier: A unique identifier for the element which encloses it
Line Break: An empty element indicating end of a line of text in the source document

Manchette: a word or phrase in italic script in the margin that indicates something in the text block It is not a heading (although sometimes it looks like it, but rather explains something in the text block

Margin Position: the location in the margin at which the parent element appears in the source document. Valid values are: "right-top", "right-middle", "right-bottom", "left-top", "left-middle", "left-bottom", "top", and "bottom"
Medical Term: medical and health-related terms or phrases, such as disease terms, as plague and mange, or medical advice, if possible
Rubric: A word or phrase in italic script in the body of the text that is not a new div, heading, or block
Sense Term: Use of the 5 senses to make qualitative assessment, but generally not visual, e.g., “luisant”
Supplied Text: Text added by the transcriber/editor. DO NOT USE IN TC. DO NOT USE IN TCN, EXCEPT IF THERE IS A MISTAKE ON THE PART OF THE AUTHOR. USE SPARINGLY IN TL.
Temporal Term: A reference to time, e.g., hour, day, season, holiday, span of time, time of day, etc
